title: The Structural phenomena in Kalat
content: The collision of the Iran and Turan plates have created some foldings, one of which is the Kalat syncline in the north-east of Iran (Koppe Dagh). This syncline along with its parallel anticlines and synclines has created a group of structural phenomena that are so sightly and valuable. The massively glorious walls in Kalat, like a sturdy fortress, appear along the East-West line. The palace of the Sun, (Sun, here is the wife of Nadershah Afshar) lies amid these walls, Kalat syncline, and the ancient inscriptions, upon the Kalat gorge, catch the eyes. Different sites of fossils, perched synclines, and other structural phenomena have built a good potentiality for the development of geotourism in this corner of the country of Iran.

gallery.caption: ST1-1 :Kalat fort-like (turret-like) walls with the east-west trend making a natural border in a part of the country
ST1-2 :A rare view of a perched syncline
ST1-3 :A very beautiful symmetric folding in Tirgan formation (Cretaceous)
ST1-4 : Another view of the Kalat wall (cliff) formed in Ay Tamir
ST1-5 : A panoramic view of the Kalat region with cliff (wall) on the right
ST1-6 : Darband gorge, the only natural passthrough Kalat wall (N-E view)
